item.title: 23 Colorful Houseplants to Warm Up Your Winter
item.description:
Wintertime can be dreary. Why not brighten things up with colorful houseplants? From fresh and tropical to old school, there are plants are available in your favorite colors that are sure to thrive in your home. Discover 23 of our favorites to find the best options suited to your indoor conditions and decor in this guide.

The post 23 Colorful Houseplants to Warm Up Your Winter appeared first on Gardener's Path.

item.title: Discover the Native Orchids of North America
item.description:
North America hosts a stunning diversity of native orchids. Learn about the fascinating world of indigenous orchids in this guide.

item.title: Winter Lawn Care: 11 Essential Tips for Healthy Grass
item.description:
Your lawn may be dormant during winter's coldest months, but proper care can save you time and money come spring. Even when growth slows, grass still needs protection and nurturing to emerge healthy and vibrant when warmer weather returns. Learn 11 essential winter lawn care tips in this guide. Read more now.

The post Winter Lawn Care: 11 Essential Tips for Healthy Grass appeared first on Gardener's Path.
item.source:markdown:
Your lawn may be dormant during winter's coldest months, but proper care can save you time and money come spring. Even when growth slows, grass still needs protection and nurturing to emerge healthy and vibrant when warmer weather returns. Learn 11 essential winter lawn care tips in this guide. Read more now.
The post [Winter Lawn Care: 11 Essential Tips for Healthy Grass](https://gardenerspath.com/how-to/lawns-and-grass/winter-care/) appeared first on [Gardener's Path](https://gardenerspath.com).

item.title: 25 of the Best Low-Light Houseplants to Liven up Your Decor
item.description:
If you’ve always wanted lush greenery in your home but lack the daylight many plants crave, it’s time to try one or more of our favorite low-light houseplants. Indoor gardening is a fun and relaxing hobby when you choose varieties appropriate to your surroundings. Read on to find your new favorites from our list of 25.

item.title: Winterizing Tiger Flowers: How to Lift and Store Tigridia Corms
item.description:
Tiger flowers (Tigridia pavonia) produce bright, eye-catching blooms in shades of red, orange, yellow, and pink, often with bold speckled patterns at the center. These tender perennials won’t survive winter temperatures in Zone 6 and below. Learn how to lift and store tiger flower corms in this guide. Read more now.

The post Winterizing Tiger Flowers: How to Lift and Store Tigridia Corms appeared first on Gardener's Path.
item.source:markdown:

item.title: Growing dragon fruit in Southern California
item.description:
When my friend Brad started growing dragon fruit some years back, his friend Simon told him not to bother with any variety except 8-S, which is also called Sugar Dragon. “I’ve tried all the other ones,” Simon told him. “Don’t bother. Just grow 8-S.” “But I have to try them for myself,” Brad had replied […]

The post Growing dragon fruit in Southern California appeared first on Greg Alder's Yard Posts: Southern California food gardening.
item.source:markdown:
When my friend Brad started growing dragon fruit some years back, his friend Simon told him not to bother with any variety except 8-S, which is also called Sugar Dragon. “I’ve tried all the other ones,” Simon told him. “Don’t bother. Just grow 8-S.” “But I have to try them for myself,” Brad had replied \[…\]
The post [Growing dragon fruit in Southern California](https://gregalder.com/yardposts/growing-dragon-fruit-in-southern-california/) appeared first on [Greg Alder's Yard Posts: Southern California food gardening](https://gregalder.com/yardposts).

item.description:

item.title: How to Grow and Care for Beaked (Big Bend) Yucca
item.description:
Beaked aka big bend yucca is the water-wise gardener's dream. This species thrives in the hot, dry conditions common to its native Texas and Mexico. Growing up to 15 feet high with sword-like blue-green leaves, beaked yucca produces a profusion of creamy white flowers in spring. Learn how to grow Yucca rostrata in this guide.

The post How to Grow and Care for Beaked (Big Bend) Yucca appeared first on Gardener's Path.
item.source:markdown:

item.title: How to Grow and Care for Claret Cup Cactus
item.description:
Claret cup cactus (Echinocereus triglochidiatus) is suited to Zones 5 to 10, where it thrives in full to partial sun with sandy, well-drained soil. Prized for its funnel-like scarlet flowers, it is an easy-care, water-wise addition to xeriscapes and patio pots. Learn how to grow claret cup cactus in this guide. Read more.

The post How to Grow and Care for Claret Cup Cactus appeared first on Gardener's Path.

item.title: How to Identify and Manage Downy Mildew in Lettuce
item.description:
Downy mildew is a persistent disease that affects lettuce crops. It creates yellow spots on leaves and fuzzy growth on undersides, potentially ruining entire harvests. item.title: Franquette: Celebrating Sacramento’s Farm-to-Fork Bounty
item.description:
Franquette, a popular Sacramento cafe and wine bar, serves French-inspired fare – but the execution is entirely Californian. item.source:markdown:
Franquette, a popular Sacramento cafe and wine bar, serves French-inspired fare – but the execution is entirely Californian. Owner Brad Cecchi and Head Chef Elena Winks transform seasonal, local produce and products into something utterly unforgettable. Located in Sacramento’s trendy Bridge District, Franquette welcomes guests for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Brad describes it as a \[…\]

item.title: Seasonal Produce Shines at Sacramento’s Canon Restaurant
item.description:
When you put California Grown goodness in the hands of a masterful chef, the results are undeniably delicious. Experience East Sacramento’s Canon Restaurant, where each family-style dish and small plate is a love letter to the Golden State. item.title: Value of California Ag production tops $60 billion for first time
item.description: The USDA’s Economic Research Service (ERS) has released production data summaries for 2024 in California, with a total value for the year of $61.2 billion, an increase of 3.6 percent from 2023. This is the first time that the state’s … Continue reading →
